topic.title: Hello guys
topic.body: I'm just playing around with this thing looking for a place to have freedom of speech now that everything else on the net is getting shut down. My question is... what if the internet service providers block the protocol that this thing uses? Can't they shut it down that way if all the phone companies decide to gang up together?

topic.title: I think the key to making this thing popular is the vidoes.
topic.body:
I especially think that if people were to put full HD movies on the YouTube app that people could just stream and watch straight away then you would have a flood of people joining this network. But then of course the corporations would come and do their best to shut everything down. 
Still, there has to be some sugar if you want people to join.

1545700918_12Y8rPJTMwJ3tTh5j81JPy6HrMf4K.body: I got mine uploaded, had to make it an mp4 file first though and I couldn't figure out how to put a thumbnail on it.

1522586677_1CuFXko1Q3MMRkboFygeu9DxNVAFG.body: Has ZN figured a way to get around being blocked by Three mobile?
